intro: Halimocnemis microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved halimocnemis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flower heads that resemble daisies. It typically grows in rocky soils and is well adapted to drought conditions. Halimocnemis microphylla is often used in traditional medicine and is also valued for its ornamental appeal.
